context: In 2024, Zuora operated in a highly competitive and fragmented market. The company faced pressure from multiple directions: established enterprise vendors (Salesforce, Oracle NetSuite), specialized subscription platforms (Chargebee, Recurly, Maxio), and emerging modern billing solutions (Orb, Zenskar). Key competitive differentiators included implementation speed, pricing transparency, ease of use, and support for complex pricing models. A significant development occurred in October 2024 when Silver Lake Management acquired Zuora for $1.7 billion, taking the company private.
